title: Potential energy - object falling with drag

content.question: An object is released from rest near the surface of Earth. Initially, the object accelerates as it begins to fall towards the Earth’s surface. Earth’s atmosphere exerts a resistive force on the object, and it reaches a terminal velocity before landing. Which of the following claims about the gravitational potential energy of the object-Earth system is true?

choices.label: The gravitational potential energy remains constant during the initial acceleration period but then decreases as the object falls at terminal velocity.
The gravitational potential energy decreases during the initial acceleration period but then remains constant as the object falls at terminal velocity.
The gravitational potential energy remains constant both during the initial acceleration period and as the object falls at terminal velocity.
The gravitational potential energy decreases both during the initial acceleration period and as the object falls at terminal velocity.

content.answer: The gravitational potential energy decreases both during the initial acceleration period and as the object falls at terminal velocity.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
